subject: Design
title: Chinese Porcelain: Design Meets Mass Production
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Chinese Porcelain: Design Meets Mass Production.

hook.text: In the 7th century, Chinese potters solved a problem: how to make beauty at scale.

buildup.text: They standardized clay formulas, kiln temperatures, and glaze recipes across workshops.

discovery.text: Blue-and-white porcelain became the world's first mass-produced luxury design object.

twist.text: European royals went bankrupt collecting it. Entire trade routes existed just for porcelain.

climax.text: China proved that great design doesn't have to be one-of-a-kind â€” it can be systematic.

punchline.text: The first design system wasn't digital. It was ceramic.

quiz.question: What made Chinese porcelain revolutionary in design history?
options: Mass production of a luxury design object
